page.title: 13Law and Order in St. John
page.content: In Jersey there are two{Police Forces. One is the professional service which covers the whole Island. The second force is known as The{Honorary Police system which has elected members from each Parish. The St. John Honorary Police force is typical being composed of two {"Centeniers,"}three{"Vingteniers,"}and twelve{Constables Officers.}Their duties involve the policing of the Parish under the leadership of the {"Connetable,"}(the Constable of the Parish) and also collecting the{Parish {Rates.}Anyone arrested on suspicion of crime may only be charged by a Centenier. {Modern equipment}available to the local force includes a patrol car, equipped with two-way radio and hand-held radio systems.
